update.description: Ready for review - This PR adds the grid to ogre 2.  It was targeted at Citadel due to the utilization of the `Ogre2DynamicRenderable` class which can't be backported due to API/ABI breaks.

content.raw: I changed it back, the reason I originally added a slight offset is that after the grid is updated via the grid config plugin, it becomes slightly lighter in color which is due to the intersection between the plane and the grid I would assume.
content.html: I changed it back, the reason I originally added a slight offset is that after the grid is updated via the grid config plugin, it becomes slightly lighter in color which is due to the intersection between the plane and the grid I would assume.

content.raw: is this change intended? The z pos of the grid can be changed by the user by setting parent node’s position, e.g. in ign-gazebo it’s done [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/src/dd4ff2a4c1112a8727c12a2e927e87ca64392611/src/rendering/RenderUtil.cc#lines-988)
content.html: is this change intended? The z pos of the grid can be changed by the user by setting parent node’s position, e.g. in ign-gazebo it’s done here

content.raw: Awesome! Thanks for fixing this, the test passes now for me
content.html: Awesome! Thanks for fixing this, the test passes now for me

content.raw:
thanks for looking into this! Turns out that an ogre material shared pointer was not cleaned up so its destructor was being called again after the engine shuts down.

[76b0a24](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/commits/76b0a2456babb33fe5916a4e08ae89ffdeb6e682)  should fix the problem and make the test pass.
content.html:
thanks for looking into this! Turns out that an ogre material shared pointer was not cleaned up so its destructor was being called again after the engine shuts down.

76b0a24 should fix the problem and make the test pass.

update.description: Ready for review - This PR adds the grid to ogre 2.  It was targeted at Citadel due to the utilization of the `Ogre2DynamicRenderable` class which can't be backported due to API/ABI breaks.
update.title: Ogre2 grid

content.raw: After some investigation, I somewhat believe this error to be an artifact of how the materials are cleaned up rather than this implementation of ogre2 grid, although I could be wrong.  This grid test for Ogre1 and Ogre2 behaves the same way in both cases in terms of Material cleanup order, except the ogre2 version results in a crash.  For both versions of ogre, the material that the grid makes a copy of is destroyed before the grid’s deconstructor is called - I believe this occurs when the destroy call is made to the scene.  This same material’s deconstructor is called again when the grid’s deconstructor is called - this is called after the scene has been destroyed - this is where the crash occurs in Ogre2, it is actually a failed assertion, possibly one that is not made in Ogre1.  What further supports this being an artifact of the clean order is the fac that I removed the last two lines in the test that destroy the scene and unload the engine, and the Ogre2 test runs successfully.  Any thoughts? @{557058:10b01d41-a2e9-4a41-a907-e6e2f03b6cd5}
content.html: After some investigation, I somewhat believe this error to be an artifact of how the materials are cleaned up rather than this implementation of ogre2 grid, although I could be wrong. This grid test for Ogre1 and Ogre2 behaves the same way in both cases in terms of Material cleanup order, except the ogre2 version results in a crash. For both versions of ogre, the material that the grid makes a copy of is destroyed before the grid’s deconstructor is called - I believe this occurs when the destroy call is made to the scene. This same material’s deconstructor is called again when the grid’s deconstructor is called - this is called after the scene has been destroyed - this is where the crash occurs in Ogre2, it is actually a failed assertion, possibly one that is not made in Ogre1. What further supports this being an artifact of the clean order is the fac that I removed the last two lines in the test that destroy the scene and unload the engine, and the Ogre2 test runs successfully. Any thoughts? @Ian Chen

content.raw:
can you enable the [grid test for ogre2](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/src/6ed27e29a6e03d749c93a44b3f50f415e6be6c3e/src/Grid_TEST.cc#lines-39)

To run ogre2 tests:

```
 RENDER_ENGINE_VALUES=ogre2 ./bin/UNIT_Grid_TEST
```

‌
content.html:
can you enable the grid test for ogre2

To run ogre2 tests:

 RENDER_ENGINE_VALUES=ogre2 ./bin/UNIT_Grid_TEST

‌

content.raw: Solved it - wasn’t clearing the grid before updating it with new info from the plugin.

content.raw:
I’m going to make a forward port PR for the GUI config tool so the tool can be used to test the ogre2 grid.

Here are some pictures of the grid:

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/1897253302-Screenshot_from_2020-03-06_12-49-03.png)
‌

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/zq9ear/images/459907331-Screenshot_from_2020-03-06_12-49-07.png)
~~The grid looks a bit odd due to the~~ `Ogre2DynamicRenderable` ~~class generating shadows, I decided to prioritize the gui config forward port then come back to this issue later as it might be more time than it seems.~~
content.html:
I’m going to make a forward port PR for the GUI config tool so the tool can be used to test the ogre2 grid.

Here are some pictures of the grid:

‌

The grid looks a bit odd due to the Ogre2DynamicRenderable class generating shadows, I decided to prioritize the gui config forward port then come back to this issue later as it might be more time than it seems.
